name: Vibe Hotel North Sydney

reviews.text: Stayed here for my friend's wedding -she lives nearby, we were visiting from England. Brilliant location for seeing Sydney - right opposite Milsons Point railway station, only a few miinutes over the Harbour Bridge to the center of Sydney & all ferries, trains etc. Also close to the ferry stop which takes you to Darling Harbour (near the Olympic pool, not that well sign-posted) A very smart, modern hotel with great rooms. The higher up you are the better the views over the bays. Great rooftop pool too. Slightly worrying for older guests in our party - in their 70's they were told on check-in (as we were) that they needed to leave a credit card as deposit "in case they trashed the room!!" Also staff were not very accomodating of my friend who was leaving from there for her wedding & would not let her have her room one minute early!
reviews.title: Good Viibes

likes.liked: — Smart, modern, great views & good location
likes.disliked: — Snooty check-in staff who thought everyone would trash their room!

reviews.text: The suites on the top floors are much bigger, but the bathrooms are actually smaller than in the cheaper rooms. We didn't eat there although the restaurants looked fine - there are great breakfast places just along the road & around the corner, & if you go under the railway station some lovely Italian & Thai restaurants that are great value for the evening. I've been to Sydney many times & I would definitely stay here again - it's smart, modern & spotless, if a little impersonal. It's definitely a hotel for adults not kids.
reviews.title: A 'hairy' experience...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visiting friends in the area, I booked the nearby Vibe hotel for 1 night on [--]... Whilst comparatively cheap, I came away with the vibe that this property doesn't represent very good value for money.
reviews.title: Bad Vibrations

likes.disliked: — the service at the front desk.

reviews.text: The (standard queen) room was clean and fairly comfortable, with pleasant views over the harbor/Kiribilli. The large amount of mold on bathroom tiles gave the bathroom a tired feel.
reviews.title: A little tired and in need of some TLC
Vibe North Sydney great for "out of towners"
reviews.text: A real let-down was the breakfast. My expectations weren't huge - this is a 4 star establishment which seems largely directed at the youth market... I found someone else's hair lodged in my mango which was very off-putting, then just a few minutes later, my dad who had joined me for breakfast found a different hair baked into his bread! Severely off-putting! Also disappointing was discovering that the mini marmalade on our table was not fresh and had already been opened and left there.

reviews.title: There are better hotels but for the price ($A150) it was ok
reviews.text: We stayed for one night with many other family members all in separate rooms. Although we all booked together, we were not all on the same floor as requested. But that was not the end of the world, it was a large group and that is understandable. Views are great, location is excellent, opposite Milson's Point train station and 5 minutes to the city on the train. I also stayed at the hotel when it was "The Duxton" and I think the decor and service were better then. We had a problem with parking, but fluked the last park quite luckily, it was a Saturday night. Breakfast was ok, service was ok. The staff were nothing to rave about as far as service goes - the staff were quiet rude to me and some of the rest of our family - and did not go out of their own way to assist either at reception or at breakfast. The decor is quite tired although the website says it was renovated in 2004. Reception and restaurant are funky but rooms are a bit dated. But the views make up for it. Average sized rooms, average sized bathrooms. I found it cheaper on the Vibe Hotel website than thru any other hotel booking website.
We have stayed at the Vibe hotel several times.
reviews.title: Great Stay
good hotel but be aware of parking difficulty
reviews.text: I must admit when it was a Duxton it was slightly better in most ways.

reviews.title: Bad Vibe
reviews.text: However we got a room right up the top with an awesome view that really made up for any lackings!

reviews.title: Excellent Location
reviews.text: This was the second time that we stayed at the Vibe Hotel at North Sydney. The main purpose of the stay was to be close to the start of the Half Marathon event (Marathon and Fun Runs start from the same location). Last year we had a room with a view of the harbour. This year we had a room without the view, but the interior of the room was of similar quality. The room was a comfortable size with a queen bed, sofa, coffee table, desk and chair. The room and furnishings were very clean. The staff was extremely helpful and polite. Parking was available in the building for this year's visit. The location is excellent, even if you are not planning to participate in the events, as it is about 200 metres from the Milsons Point Railway Station, 400 metres from Sydney Harbour, 200 metres from the Harbour Bridge and relatively peaceful. We look forward to another visit next year.

My bridesmaid and I wanted to stay somewhere close by to where my wedding was and vibe was recommended by the venue. After leaving our bags there and checking in (but not into the room) earlier in the day, we arrived later that night to be told we did not have a room and that there was nothing resembling our name in the system. This misunderstanding was overcome by the duty manager (but with some unnecessary rudeness thrown in we thought) but then we ended up being given a key to a room with someone else in it. Not a nice thing to walk in on someone while they are sleeping - and not nice for the sleeping person either I imagine!! After another trip downstairs to reception we got another room key to the real room but this did not work. It took even more trips up and down the lift for this to be sorted out and by this stage we were both getting very annoyed at both the service we had been given and the general rudeness and bad attitudes that we were encountering. We realise that we were not acting the angels by this stage either but the way we were treated was totally uncalled for. Eventually, we had to call the groom to come to the hotel from the other side of the city and sort it out for us as we had both become quite upset after all these hassles. Finally we got into our room and it turned out to be quite nice (it was a suite) with a view over the harbour but unfortnately we were in no mood to enjoy the night lights.
reviews.title: Not a happy start to the wedding...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on the verge of just checking out the next day and being done with the place rather than staying the next 2 nights we had booked, however, the new duty manager the next morning was the ultimate professional and apologised for what had happened, asked us for our side of the story and treated us with the respect that had been missing from the night before. He compensated us for our inconvenience and made general amends for our bad experience.
reviews.title: Very tired looking room.

reviews.text: The rest of the stay was largely uneventful although the toilet was always running (which is annoying when trying to sleep) and the room was starting to show some signs of wear and tear. The wedding went ahead so that is the main thing I guess!!
reviews.title: Gret little secret in North Sydney

likes.liked: — Closeness to public transport, room comfort

reviews.text: This was our 3rd stay at this hotel. Our 1st and 2nd stay here were lovely however we were disappointed this time.
reviews.title: Would not go back...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic location for anyone who is not too familiar with Sydney as it was the perfect location. Loved walking around Lavendar and Kirribilli Bay. Staff were very helpful at reception. A bonus arriving in Sydney early morning (our original plan was to drop off the luggage) but the staff said that our room was ready and we could check in at 9.30am! Vibe's marketing material highlights a crisp and clean upmarket hotel. The upgrade is great but it shows a little wear and tear already. I was surprised that management did not notice this when they check rooms. It wasn't as fresh, new and sparkly as I had hoped for compared with the promtional material on the web and brochures. It's amazing what a professional photographer can do. Overall, after staying 2 nights in a Aqua View room I would recommend this hotel to anyone who needs an excellent location and it is pretty good value. A bit of a difference compared to staying in a 5 star hotel. But you can save quite a bit of money when booking online or take up the specials. I would rather have the difference in money to spend in Sydney than pay an outrage price for a room in the city.
reviews.title: Fantastic location

likes.disliked: — maintenance of room was a a bit neglected (ceiling needed repair, grouting in bathroom neglected)

reviews.text: The best position re ease of commuting - Milsons Point Station was opposite the hotel, the ferry to Circular Quay was an easy ten minute stroll. On the opposite side of the station there was a great street - Broughton Street, which was full of great restaurants. Nice safe area to be in. However, the room while comfortable was basic, lacking such essentials as a fan in the bathroom! Apparently none of the rooms have a fan in the bathroom - we asked! So bathroom was fogged up after someone had a shower/bath. The presence of a fan in the bathroom of any 4 star hotel should be a given. The room service menu is very basic. We wanted an Iced chocolate or Iced Coffee, which they told us they did not do! Having stayed there for 3 nights while attending a conference: a colleague stayed one further night paying for an upgrade to a better room: when she asked for a late check-out (one hour later than was the norm) , they would not extend her occupancy unless she paid for another night.
reviews.title: Great position

likes.liked: — Position, Position, Position. Great locale for travelling to/from Sydney sights
likes.disliked: — Room and Hotel facilities very basic - canot remmeber when I last stayed in a 4 star hotel without something so baic as a fan in a bathroom. However, beds were clean and comfortable. For locale, to see Sydney sights, I would stay here again.

reviews.text: We had heard this hotel had small rooms but ourAqua room was lovely, we had a lovely view of Lavender Bay , Luna PArk and could even see the end of the Harbour bridge. The location is great-right opposite the railway station and the city,Rocks etc was so easy to get to.
reviews.title: great vibes @the Vibe North Sydney

reviews.text: Staff couldnt have been more helpful and very friendly. our breakfast was fine, we didnt have other meals there as we were out and about during our 4 days there and there are lots of restaurents nearby.
reviews.title: Vibe Hotel was quite good

reviews.text: we will definatly stay again, it is great value.
reviews.title: Good Location, Average Hotel

aka: Vibe Hotel North Sydney Milsons Point, Australia
